slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे | ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhrī bhagavān uvācha | idaṁ tu te guhyatamaṁ pravakṣhyāmyanasūyave | jñānaṁ vijñāna-sahitaṁ yaj jñātvā mokṣhyase 'śhubhāt ||
slokas.meaning: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: My dear Arjuna, because you are never envious of Me, I shall impart to you this most confidential knowledge and realization, knowing which you shall be relieved of the miseries of material existence.

slokas.sanskrit: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् | प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṁ pavitram idam uttamam | pratyakṣhāvagamaṁ dharmyaṁ su-sukhaṁ kartum avyayam ||
slokas.meaning: This knowledge is the king of education, the most secret of all secrets. It is the purest knowledge, and because it gives direct perception of the self by realization, it is the perfection of religion. It is everlasting, and it is joyfully performed.

slokas.sanskrit: अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप | अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि ||
slokas.pronunciation: aśhraddadhānāḥ puruṣhā dharmasyāsya parantapa | aprāpya māṁ nivartante mṛityu-saṁsāra-vartmani ||
slokas.meaning: Those who are not faithful in this devotional service cannot attain Me, O conqueror of enemies. Therefore they return to the path of birth and death in this material world.

slokas.sanskrit: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना | मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ||
slokas.pronunciation: mayā tatam idaṁ sarvaṁ jagad avyakta-mūrtinā | mat-sthāni sarva-bhūtāni na chāhaṁ teṣhv avasthitaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: By Me, in My unmanifested form, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings are in Me, but I am not in them.

slokas.sanskrit: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् | भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ||
slokas.pronunciation: na cha mat-sthāni bhūtāni paśhya me yogam aiśhwaram | bhūta-bhṛin na cha bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: And yet everything that is created does not rest in Me. Behold My mystic opulence! Although I am the maintainer of all living entities and although I am everywhere, I am not a part of this cosmic manifestation, for My Self is the very source of creation.

slokas.sanskrit: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् | तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ||
slokas.pronunciation: yathākāśha-sthito nityaṁ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahān | tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānītyupadhāraya ||
slokas.meaning: As the mighty wind, blowing everywhere, rests always in the sky, know that in the same manner all beings rest in Me.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् | कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛitiṁ yānti māmikām | kalpa-kṣhaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛijāmyaham ||
slokas.meaning: O son of Kunti, at the end of the millennium all material manifestations enter into My nature, and at the beginning of another millennium, by My potency, I create them again.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः | भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ||
slokas.pronunciation: prakṛitiṁ svām avaṣhṭabhya visṛijāmi punaḥ punaḥ | bhūta-grāmam imaṁ kṛitsnam avaśhaṁ prakṛiter vaśhāt ||
slokas.meaning: The whole cosmic order is under Me. Under My will it is automatically manifested again and again, and under My will it is annihilated at the end.

slokas.sanskrit: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय | उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ||
slokas.pronunciation: na cha māṁ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya | udāsīna-vad āsīnam asaktaṁ teṣhu karmasu ||
slokas.meaning: O Dhananjaya, all this work cannot bind Me. I am ever detached from all these material activities, seated as though neutral.

slokas.sanskrit: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् | हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ||
slokas.pronunciation: mayādhyakṣheṇa prakṛitiḥ sūyate sa-charācharam | hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate ||
slokas.meaning: This material nature, which is one of My energies, is working under My direction, O son of Kunti, producing all moving and nonmoving beings. Under its rule this manifestation is created and annihilated again and again.

slokas.sanskrit: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् | परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: avajānanti māṁ mūḍhā mānuṣhīṁ tanum āśhritam | paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśhvaram ||
slokas.meaning: Fools deride Me when I descend in the human form. They do not know My transcendental nature as the Supreme Lord of all that be.

slokas.sanskrit: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः | राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: moghāśhā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vichetasaḥ | rākṣhasīm āsurīṁ chaiva prakṛitiṁ mohinīṁ śhritāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Those who are thus bewildered are attracted by demonic and atheistic views. In that deluded condition, their hopes for liberation, their fruitive activities, and their culture of knowledge are all defeated.

slokas.sanskrit: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः | भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: mahātmānas tu māṁ pārtha daivīṁ prakṛitim āśhritāḥ | bhajantyananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam ||
slokas.meaning: O son of Pritha, those who are not deluded, the great souls, are under the protection of the divine nature. They are fully engaged in devotional service because they know Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, original and inexhaustible.

slokas.sanskrit: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः | नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ||
slokas.pronunciation: satataṁ kīrtayanto māṁ yatantaśh cha dṛiḍha-vratāḥ | namasyantaśh cha māṁ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate ||
slokas.meaning: Always chanting My glories, endeavoring with great determination, bowing down before Me, these great souls perpetually worship Me with devotion.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते | एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: jñāna-yajñena chāpyanye yajanto mām upāsate | ekatvena pṛithaktvena bahudhā viśhvato-mukham ||
slokas.meaning: Others, who engage in cultivation of knowledge, worship Me as the Supreme Lord, in various forms - as one, as distinct, or as the universal form.

slokas.sanskrit: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् | मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: ahaṁ kratur ahaṁ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣhadham | mantro 'ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṁ hutam ||
slokas.meaning: But it is I who am the ritual, I the sacrifice, the offering to the ancestors, the healing herb, the transcendental chant. I am the butter and the fire and the offering.

slokas.sanskrit: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः | वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ||
slokas.pronunciation: pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ | vedyaṁ pavitram oṁkāra ṛik sāma yajur eva cha ||
slokas.meaning: I am the father of this universe, the mother, the support and the grandsire. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier and the syllable om. I am also the Rig, the Sama and the Yajur Vedas.

slokas.sanskrit: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् | प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣhī nivāsaḥ śharaṇaṁ suhṛit | prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṁ nidhānaṁ bījam avyayam ||
slokas.meaning: I am the goal, the sustainer, the master, the witness, the abode, the refuge, and the most dear friend. I am the creation and the annihilation, the basis of everything, the resting place and the eternal seed.

slokas.sanskrit: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च | अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ||
slokas.pronunciation: tapāmyaham ahaṁ varṣhaṁ nigṛihṇāmyutsṛijāmi cha | amṛitaṁ chaiva mṛityuśh cha sad asach chāham arjuna ||
slokas.meaning: O Arjuna, I give heat, and I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality, and I am also death personified. Both spirit and matter are in Me.

slokas.sanskrit: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते | ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोक मश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ||
slokas.pronunciation: trai-vidyā māṁ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpā yajñair iṣhṭvā svar-gatiṁ prārthayante | te puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokam aśhnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān ||
slokas.meaning: Those who study the Vedas and drink the soma juice, seeking the heavenly planets, worship Me indirectly. Purified of sinful reactions, they take birth on the pious, heavenly planet of Indra, where they enjoy godly delights.

slokas.sanskrit: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति | एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ||
slokas.pronunciation: te taṁ bhuktvā swarga-lokaṁ viśhālaṁ kṣhīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṁ viśhanti | evaṁ trayī-dharmam anuprapannā gatāgataṁ kāma-kāmā labhante ||
slokas.meaning: When they have thus enjoyed vast heavenly sense pleasure and the results of their pious activities are exhausted, they return to this mortal planet again. Thus those who seek sense enjoyment by following the principles of the three Vedas achieve only repeated birth and death.

slokas.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते | तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: ananyāśh chintayanto māṁ ye janāḥ paryupāsate | teṣhāṁ nityābhiyuktānāṁ yoga-kṣhemaṁ vahāmyaham ||
slokas.meaning: But those who always worship Me with exclusive devotion, meditating on My transcendental form – to them I carry what they lack, and I preserve what they have.

slokas.sanskrit: येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः | तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: ye 'pyanya-devatā-bhaktā yajante śhraddhayānvitāḥ | te 'pi mām eva kaunteya yajantyavidhi-pūrvakam ||
slokas.meaning: Those who are devotees of other gods and who worship them with faith actually worship only Me, O son of Kunti, but they do so in a wrong way.

slokas.sanskrit: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च | न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ||
slokas.pronunciation: ahaṁ hi sarva-yajñānāṁ bhoktā cha prabhureva cha | na tu māmabhijānanti tattvenātaśhchyavanti te ||
slokas.meaning: I am the only enjoyer and master of all sacrifices. Therefore, those who do not recognize My true transcendental nature fall down.

slokas.sanskrit: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः | भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: yānti deva-vratā devān pitṝīn yānti pitṛi-vratāḥ | bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti mad-yājino 'pi mām ||
slokas.meaning: Those who worship the demigods will take birth among the demigods; those who worship the ancestors go to the ancestors; those who worship ghosts and spirits will take birth among such beings; and those who worship Me will live with Me.

slokas.sanskrit: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति | तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ||
slokas.pronunciation: patraṁ puṣhpaṁ phalaṁ toyaṁ yo me bhaktyā prayachchhati | tadahaṁ bhaktyupahṛitam aśhnāmi prayatātmanaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit or water, I will accept it.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् | यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: yat karoṣhi yad aśhnāsi yaj juhoṣhi dadāsi yat | yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣhva mad-arpaṇam ||
slokas.meaning: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer or give away, and whatever austerities you perform – do that, O son of Kunti, as an offering to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः | संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhubhāśhubha-phalair evaṁ mokṣhyase karma-bandhanaiḥ | sannyāsa-yoga-yuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣhyasi ||
slokas.meaning: In this way you will be freed from bondage to work and its auspicious and inauspicious results. With your mind fixed on Me in this principle of renunciation, you will be liberated and come to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः | ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: samo 'haṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu na me dveṣhyo 'sti na priyaḥ | ye bhajanti tu māṁ bhaktyā mayi te teṣhu chāpyaham ||
slokas.meaning: I envy no one, nor am I partial to anyone. I am equal to all. But whoever renders service unto Me in devotion is a friend, is in Me, and I am also a friend to him.

slokas.sanskrit: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् | साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ||
slokas.pronunciation: api chet su-durāchāro bhajate mām ananya-bhāk | sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Even if one commits the most abominable action, if he is engaged in devotional service he is to be considered saintly because he is properly situated in his determination.

slokas.sanskrit: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति | कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ||
slokas.pronunciation: kṣhipraṁ bhavati dharmātmā śhaśhvach-chhāntiṁ nigachchhati | kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśhyati ||
slokas.meaning: He quickly becomes righteous and attains lasting peace. O son of Kunti, declare it boldly that My devotee never perishes.

slokas.sanskrit: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः | स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: māṁ hi pārtha vyapāśhritya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpa-yonayaḥ | striyo vaiśhyās tathā śhūdrās te 'pi yānti parāṁ gatim ||
slokas.meaning: O son of Pritha, those who take shelter in Me, though they be of lower birth – women, vaishyas [merchants] and shudras [workers] – can attain the supreme destination.

slokas.sanskrit: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा | अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: kiṁ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣhayas tathā | anityam asukhaṁ lokam imaṁ prāpya bhajasva mām ||
slokas.meaning: How much more this is so of the righteous brahmanas, the devotees and the saintly kings. Therefore, having come to this temporary, miserable world, engage in loving service unto Me.

slokas.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु | मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः ||
slokas.pronunciation: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru | mām evaiṣhyasi yuktvaivam ātmānaṁ mat-parāyaṇaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.
